comments.body: Do we still need this check?
This check is for the normal case where portchannel is a string. I could remove it and leave the single check on line 265.

@rahushen I think we can ignore this check because portchannel is actually digit, it is just we have arg param as str. The added check already does the typecasting `int(portchannel)`. Hence the first check looks unnecessary to me.
@trishnaguha This has been taken care of now! Also, this needs to be merged into 2.4.1 as well.

@trishnaguha ... thinking more about this, I think the check is needed. 

get_portchannel_list(module) returns the portchannel list from device (string on most devices and int on only N1). 

`if not portchannel.isdigit() or int(portchannel) not in get_portchannel_list(module): `

The above check will fail for all other platforms because type casting portchannel to int will break string equality check. Hence we need both checks.
ACK. Merging this on devel and cherry-picking to 2.4.
